abstract: JPMorgan’s long-term debt costs need to be watched closely. In the first quarter, JPMorgan paid a higher interest rate on its third-largest source of funds – $255 billion of long-term debt.
snippet: JPMorgan’s long-term debt costs need to be watched closely. In the first quarter, JPMorgan paid a higher interest rate on its third-largest source of funds – $255 billion of long-term debt.
lead_paragraph: One number in JPMorgan Chase’s first-quarter earnings suggests that not everyone believes in the fortress balance sheet.

headline.main: What JPMorgan’s Bonds Say About the Fortress Balance Sheet
